description: A Gear Third technique where Luffy inflates his arm to gigantic proportions by biting his thumb and blowing air into his bones. He then delivers a massive punch with devastating force, capable of destroying ships and defeating powerful opponents. The attack combines the raw power of Gear Third's size manipulation with Luffy's standard Pistol technique.

reveals.revelation: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Gigant Pistol as a finishing move to defeat Largo, sending him flying into his own ship and destroying it.

mechanics: The technique utilizes Gear Third's bone inflation mechanism to create an arm of enormous size. The inflated arm is then launched forward as a punch, creating tremendous impact force due to its mass and speed.
limitations: After using Gear Third, Luffy's body typically shrinks temporarily due to air loss, though this side effect diminishes as he masters the technique.
strategicApplications: Creating overwhelming offensive pressure in battle
culturalSignificance: Represents Luffy's growing mastery of Gear Third and his ability to adapt his fighting style to different opponents.

description: A biological ability gained by Boss after molting. He can breathe fire from openings in his enlarged horns, creating powerful flames for offensive and defensive purposes. This ability is a result of his artificial modification by Dr. Indigo.

reveals.revelation: Boss gains fire-breathing capability after completing his molting process, revealing enhanced combat abilities as part of his artificial design.

mechanics: Fire is generated and expelled through special openings in Boss's enlarged tusks, likely through a biological mechanism engineered by Dr. Indigo as part of Shiki's modified creature program.
limitations: The exact range and intensity of the fire breath are not fully demonstrated in this episode.
culturalSignificance: Demonstrates the extent of Dr. Indigo's biological modification capabilities and foreshadows the power of Shiki's modified creature army.

description: An advanced application of the Ami Ami no Mi where the user transforms their entire body into a net structure. This allows them to trap opponents inside their own stomach while dispersing physical force across the net surface, providing defense similar to Logia-type Devil Fruits. The net can have spikes and other modifications for additional lethality.

reveals.revelation: Largo reveals the full extent of his Ami Ami no Mi powers by transforming his entire body into a spiked net to trap Luffy, demonstrating abilities beyond simple net creation.

mechanics: The user's body restructures into a net formation, allowing physical attacks to pass through or be dispersed across the net's surface. Opponents can be enveloped and trapped within the net structure.
limitations: Can be overcome by extreme size changes (as demonstrated by Luffy's Gear Third inflation) or cutting attacks that can sever the net structure.
strategicApplications: Defensive dispersal of blunt force attacks
culturalSignificance: Demonstrates the creative applications possible with Paramecia-type Devil Fruits, even anime-only ones.
